args.natural_language_statement:
Let A be a linear operator on R^n. Show that the operator norm on R^n defined by ||A|| = max { ||Ax|| : ||x|| = 1 }, is equal to the supremum sup{ ||Ax|| : ||x|| â‰¤ 1 }, and also equal to the supremum sup{ ||Ax|| : ||x|| < 1 }.

args.content:
import Mathlib

/-! Let A be a linear operator on â„^n. The operator norm on â„^n defined by
    â€–Aâ€– = max { â€–A xâ€– : â€–xâ€– = 1 }
  is equal to the supremum over the closed unit ball and the open unit ball.
  The statement below is given in the generality of continuous linear maps between
  real normed spaces. -/

variable {E F : Type*} [NormedAddCommGroup E] [NormedAddCommGroup F]
  [NormedSpace â„ E] [NormedSpace â„ F]

theorem operator_norm_eq_sups (A : E â†’L[â„] F) :
  A.opNorm = Sup ((fun x : E => â€–A xâ€–) '' {x | â€–xâ€– = 1}) âˆ§
  A.opNorm = Sup ((fun x : E => â€–A xâ€–) '' {x | â€–xâ€– â‰¤ 1}) âˆ§
  A.opNorm = Sup ((fun x : E => â€–A xâ€–) '' {x | â€–xâ€– < 1}) := by sorry
